result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric J. Larson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:57 pm 
INCLUDES 15CM812 AND 15CM1078. 
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher; Def appears in person with Atty Kat Jackan.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 15CM812: Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
                     : Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
                     : Ct. 4 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
In 15CM1078: Ct. 1 (Criminal Damage to Property/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                       : Ct. 2 (DC/Repeater)>>DELETE Repeater enhancer. 
                       : Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CM812: Ct. 1 (Misd. OWI 4th)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 15CM1078: Amended Ct. 2 (DC)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Atty Jackan makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 15CM812: Ct. 1 (Misd. OWI 4th)>>$2605 inclusive with 60 days to pay or payment plan; AODA with $165 fee; DNA sample; 170 days MCJ with huber if def qualifies to run concurrent to jail in 15CM1078; Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 30 months, as is the defendant himself; 30 month dl revocation with admin credit. 
In 15CM1078: Amended Ct. 2 (DC)>>90 days MCJ with huber for work/treatment if def qualifies to run concurrent to jail in 15CM812; DNA sample and surcharge; CC w/ 60 days to pay or payment plan. 
COURT finds the def entitled to NO days jail credit in 15CM812 and 2 days jail credit in 15CM1078. 
COURT ORDERS half priced IID. 
COURT remands def into custody to begin jail sentence immediately. 
Adj: 4:10 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-10-2015 03:45 pm

Clerk Marisa.

INCLUDES 15CM812 AND 15CM1078.

State notes parties have an agreement, but deft is requesting more time before proceeding to plea. 
Atty Jackan requests adjournment of plea hearing. 
COURT grants requests to reschedule plea hearing.

Bond Continues.

Clerk Marisa.
